definition: to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to cry one's heart out
pinyin: ku1 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: to be madly in love
pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

sentences.english: We seldom have a holiday. It is out of humanity to make up the fucuking missed lessons.
sentences.chinese: 難得放假，卻讓我們補課補得死去活來，真不人道。

sentences.english: Later, however, she heard him weeping lustily in his bed.
sentences.chinese: 可是，後來她聽見他在牀上哭得死去活來。

sentences.english: He was badly beaten up by a gang of thugs.
sentences.chinese: 他被一幫暴徒打得死去活來。

sentences.english: I was injured by you and half alive coax a few words and good right.
sentences.chinese: 我就是被你傷的死去活來然後哄幾句又好的爛好人。

definition: lit. cuts and bruises all over (idiom); fig. totally refuted
bruised/riddled with scars
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
heartless/without regard for others' feelings
to stop breathing/to breathe one's last/to die/to cut the gas supply
to collapse/to crumble/to fall apart
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
first love
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
